episodes.natural_language:
Case: Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024. The client is Elizabeth Lindsey.

On Monday, December 9, 2024, at 1:45:57 PM Eastern Time, Jessica from Whaley Law Firm wrote to Aptiva Referrals with the subject “RE: Elizabeth Lindsey.” In the body of the message, she provided Auto Owners Insurance information for the claim: PO Box 221409, Louisville, KY 40252; Claim number 300-793616-2024; Adjuster Chandler Wolfe, phone 502-253-0960 x. 54628, and email lexington.clm@aoins.com. The email was sent to Aptiva Referrals and CC’d to ElizabethLindseyMVAZ4830969@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com. Jessica signed off with “Have a great day!”

Also on December 9, 2024, Aptiva Referrals sent a reply to Jessica (dated 1:33 PM) with the subject “Elizabeth Lindsey.” The message stated: “Good Afternoon, We have scheduled Ms. Lindsey to be seen in our office on 12/01/24 at 115pm. When the time permits could you please send over PIP information? Thank you in advance.” The reply was sent by Shawniece Perkins, identified as a Patient In-Take Representative, and it includes the following contact details: TEL 502-909-0772, email sperkins@aptivahealth.com, website aptivahealth.com, and address 12300 Plantside Drive, Louisville, KY 40299.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024. The client on this file is Elizabeth Lindsey.

The note includes a forwarded email titled “Fwd: JEREMY C LINDSEY - 300-0793616-2024,” originally sent on January 6, 2025 at 03:51:25 GMT-05:00. The sender is Jessa Galosmo of the Whaley Law Firm, and the message was addressed to Jeremy Lindsey’s Filevine project email, Elizabeth Lindsey’s Filevine project email, Chase Lindsey’s Filevine project email, and Owen Lindsey’s Filevine project email.

The forwarded message itself contains a communication from Chandler Wolfe, dated January 6, 2025 at 12:57 PM (noted with a question mark in the original text: “12:57?PM”). The message is titled “JEREMY C LINDSEY - 300-0793616-2024” and was sent from Wolfe to jessa@whaleylawfirm.com, with KentuckyPIP.Clm CC’d. In this message, Chandler Wolfe identifies himself as the PIP adjuster on file for the Lindseys and requests that Jessa please see the attached acknowledgement letter and blank PIP forms for the clients, noting that, to date, they have not received any completed forms. He asks Jessa to let him know what additional documentation is still needed for the clients. The body of Wolfe’s message is accompanied by an embedded image placeholder: “[image: cid:image001.png@01DA0E2D.2AA737D0].”

Chandler Wolfe’s signature follows, identifying him as a Branch claims representative for Kentucky regional PIP. His contact details are: phone 800.346.0346 ext. 54628; fax 517.886.8754; email KentuckyPIP.clm@aoins.com; hours 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. EST.

The forwarded message ends with the closing from Jessa Galosmo of Whaley Law Firm, including her contact information: Ph: (502)357-9975 and Fax: (502)364-9363.

__Insurance Type:__ Bodily Injury (BI)
__Insurance Company:__ Progressive Insurance Company
__Written by:__ Justin Chumbley
 #Inotes
episodes.natural_language:
Elizabeth Lindsey is the client in the case Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024, which concerns a motor vehicle accident. The matter involves Bodily Injury (BI) coverage, with Progressive Insurance Company as the insurer. The note was written by Justin Chumbley.

New Insurance Note: On 1/21, the firm sent the available r/b to Progressive Insurance Company, the BI insurer, and requested a tender of limits. It is unclear whether the available limits exceed the minimum, but this possibility is worth exploring.
episodes.author: Filevine Integration

about.relevance: BI insurer and recipient of r/b; tender of limits requested
Bodily injury claim for which tender of limits was requested

episodes.original_body:
Case: Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024
Client: Elizabeth Lindsey

This case involves Elizabeth Lindsey and her family members who were involved in a motor vehicle accident. The case is in the early stages of gathering medical records and bills, and dealing with insurance claims.
The most recent activity involves sending a request for bills to University of Cincinnati Physicians on January 6, 2025, and faxing a completed medical authorization form to an unspecified recipient on January 3, 2025. (See details), (See details)
A potential red flag is that as of January 6, 2025, the PIP adjuster had not received any completed forms from the Lindsey family, which could delay the processing of their claim. (See details)
The next steps should include following up with the PIP adjuster to ensure all necessary forms have been submitted, and continuing to gather medical records and bills from various providers, including Radiology Associates of Northern Kentucky, PLLC. (See details), (See details)
episodes.natural_language: Elizabeth Lindsey and her family members were involved in a motor vehicle accident, and the case is in the early stages of gathering medical records and bills while addressing insurance claims. The most recent activity included faxing a completed medical authorization form to an unspecified recipient on January 3, 2025, and sending a request for medical bills to University of Cincinnati Physicians on January 6, 2025. A potential red flag is that, as of January 6, 2025, the PIP adjuster had not received any completed forms from the Lindsey family, which could delay the processing of their claim. The next steps are to follow up with the PIP adjuster to ensure all necessary forms have been submitted, and to continue gathering medical records and bills from various providers, including Radiology Associates of Northern Kentucky, PLLC.
episodes.author: Justin Chumbley

about.relevance: injured party / client involved in the MVA

about.entity_name: Radiology Associates of Northern Kentucky, PLLC
about.relevance: provider from which medical records/bills are being gathered
PIP claim with outstanding forms that may delay processing
PIP adjuster who had not received completed forms as of Jan 6, 2025

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024. Client: Elizabeth Lindsey. On Friday, January 24, 2025, at 03:10:56 GMT-05:00, Jessa Galosmo of Whaley Law Firm forwarded an email about Elizabeth Lindsey to Justin Chumbley, noting that she could not open the link even with a VPN.

Within the thread, Chandler Wolfe sent a message dated Friday, January 24, 2025 at 10:07?AM with the subject 300-0793616-2024 Elizabeth Lindsey. He stated that attached documentation had been received for Elizabeth Lindsey and asked how the office would like to proceed. The message included download instructions for Auto-Owners’ secure file transfer: 1) Click the link provided; 2) Enter your email to receive a Secure Token in a separate email; 3) Click the files to download them, with an option to download all at once by clicking “Download All” if there are multiple files. The files are available until Thursday, 13 February. The attachment listed was a single file named “Rawlings lien- Elizabeth Lindsey.pdf,” sized at 27.3 KB, with a SHA1 checksum of 335c014875ef74aaa86793e94ecb3b46034471cfd768418ac5846ccccb6e8f78. The message ID was ABANMdUSAGflY5ZpoOhBFk.

The email also contained a confidentiality disclaimer indicating that the site may contain privileged and/or confidential information intended solely for the recipient, forbidding disclosure except as permitted by law, and requiring the recipient to defend, indemnify, and hold Auto-Owners Insurance Company harmless from any damages arising from disclosure or misuse. The recipient is also expected to return, delete, and/or destroy all contents after the intended use.

The correspondence closes with “All the best,” from Jessa Galosmo of the Whaley Law Firm, including her contact details: Ph: (502)357-9975 and Fax: (502)364-9363.
episodes.author: Jessa

__Fwd: New Voice Message from LINDSEY JEREMY (502) 424-0049 on 03/14/2025 10:59 AM__
From: Jessa Galosmo [jessa@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:jessa@whaleylawfirm.com)
To: Elizabeth Lindsey - Filevine Project Email Address [ElizabethLindseyMVAZ4830969@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com](mailto:ElizabethLindseyMVAZ4830969@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com), Chase Lindsey - Filevine Project Email Address [ChaseLindseyMVAZ4831384@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com](mailto:ChaseLindseyMVAZ4831384@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com)
Date: Fri Mar 14 2025 11:10:51 GMT-04:00

Treatment update for Elizabeth and Chase

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: RingCentral 
Date: Fri, Mar 14, 2025 at 10:59?AM
Subject: New Voice Message from LINDSEY JEREMY (502) 424-0049 on 03/14/2025
10:59 AM
To: Jessa Galosmo 

[image: Logo] [image: Logo]
[image: Logo] Voice Message
------------------------------

Dear Jessa Galosmo,

You have a new voice message:
*From:* LINDSEY JEREMY (502) 424-0049
*Received:* Friday, March 14, 2025 at 10:59 AM
*Length:* 01:12
*To:* (502) 357-9975 Jessa Galosmo

*Voicemail Preview:*
"Hey, good morning. This is Jeremy Lindsey returning your call. I wanted to
provide an update for both Chase and Elizabeth. Chase has a final x ray for
his broken collarbone scheduled for april the second and hopefully we get
final clearance there. No more treatment is needed. But again, he is
scheduled for a final x ray for his collar Bone on april the second.
Elizabeth has continued treatment this following Monday, hoping that is
going to be her last treatment that is been ongoing for several weeks now.
And then she has a final consultation meeting with that orthopedist. I
believe it is in early April as well. I can get to the exact date, but
hopefully her last treatment and then she will have 1 final assessment as
well. So all things considered, assuming there is no changes, we are hoping
to have everyone cleared completely in early to mid April. So I will let
you know as soon as I know more, but that is the update for now. Thank you.
And as always, do not hesitate to reach out to you. Appreciate it."
Listen to this message over your phone or log in to your RingCentral account
 with your main number, extension number,
and password. You can also manage your voicemails in your RingCentral
account.
episodes.natural_language:
Case: Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024. Client: Elizabeth Lindsey. A treatment update for Elizabeth and Chase Lindsey was forwarded on March 14, 2025. The forwarding email came from Jessa Galosmo and was sent to Elizabeth Lindsey’s and Chase Lindsey’s Filevine project email addresses. The original message was dated March 14, 2025 at 11:10:51 AM (GMT-04:00).

The forwarded voicemail, which lasted 1 minute and 12 seconds, was from Jeremy Lindsey (502-424-0049) and was received at 10:59 AM on Friday, March 14, 2025. In the message, Jeremy stated that he was providing updates for both Chase and Elizabeth. For Chase, he said that a final X-ray for his broken collarbone is scheduled for April 2, with the hope of obtaining final clearance at that time, and that no more treatment is needed beyond the X-ray. He reiterated that the final X-ray for Chase’s collarbone is set for April 2. For Elizabeth, Jeremy reported that she has continued treatment the following Monday, hoping that this will be her last treatment after several weeks of ongoing care. She is also slated for a final consultation with the orthopedist, believed to be in early April, though the exact date was not specified. He noted that, if there are no further changes, they are hoping to have everyone cleared completely in early to mid-April, and he would update as soon as more information is known. The message concluded with thanks and an invitation to reach out if needed.
episodes.author: Jessa

about.relevance: treatment update / subject of voicemail (final X-ray scheduled)

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024

Elizabeth Lindsey, the client in the Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024 motor vehicle accident matter, was in communication with Whaley Law Firm on March 31, 2025. Jessa Galosmo emailed Elizabeth to explain that hospital bills must be paid by Elizabeth’s health insurance, and that PIP would only be used if the health insurer denies the claim. Jessa also offered that Elizabeth could call Justin the next day to review the details, providing Justin’s direct line: (502) 450-9495.

Later that day, Elizabeth replied, asking for help in getting their claims to go against their PIP and requesting information on the next steps in the process.

On March 31, 2025, Chandler Wolfe, a Branch claims representative for ky/PA regional PIP, forwarded a message to Elizabeth noting that there is an attorney on file for her claim and that she should address any questions and concerns with that attorney directly; he also cc’d the attorney’s office. Wolfe provided his contact information: p: 800.346.0346 ext. 54628; f: 517.886.8754; e: KentuckyPIP.clm@aoins.com; hours: 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. EST. He also indicated that there is a Customer Center where the client can access her claim information anytime, anywhere.

That same day, Elizabeth sent a separate message to Chandler Lindsey with the subject line Re: Claim number: 300-0793616-2024, stating, “Hello, Just wanted to follow up on this email. Can you please review and respond to the questions below? Thank you, Elizabeth.” The thread includes an earlier message from Elizabeth dated March 27, 2025 at 12:55 p.m., in which she wrote to Chandler to obtain information about claims submitted against their case (claim number 300-0793616-2024). She asked whether Cincinnati Children’s Hospital had submitted medical claims against their PIP and whether any claims had been received for Owen Lindsey and Chase Lindsey. She also asked whether there were any claims from the University of Cincinnati Hospital for Elizabeth, and she requested guidance on any additional information that might be needed. She provided her contact number: 502-210-8328.

The exchange closed with Jessa Galosmo’s signature on the communications, listing Whaley Law Firm contact details: Ph: (502) 357-9975; Fax: (502) 364-9363.
episodes.author: Jessa
